publicationStmt.p: All reuse or distribution of this work must contain somewhere a link back to the URL http://insaph.kcl.ac.uk/

div.head: Description of Monument
div.p: No description: apparently a white marble statue base shaft: Height unmeasurable; 0.38 x 0.35.

div.head: Description of Text
div.p: Inscribed on the face

div.head: Letters
div.p: Standard II-III forms; 0.02.

div.head: Date
div.p: ?early third century (contests)

div.head: Edition
div.ab:
παλαιστὴν
νεικήσαντα
Ἀφροδεισίηα
Ἀδώνηα Τιβέ
ριος Κλαύδι
ος Αὐρήλιος
Μουκιανὸς
Ἀπολλώνιος
Βερονεικια
νος ὁ κράτι
στος ἀντινε
οποιὸς Τιβε
ρίου Κλαυδί
ου Ἀπολλωνί
ου Βερονεικι
ανοῦ Ἀκάσσω
νος ἀρχιερέ
ως πάππου
ἰδίου ἐν τῇ πρώ
τῃ περιόδῳ τῆς
ἐπὶ τῇ ἀπολεί
ψει τοῦ Ἀπολ
λωνίου ἀρχι
νεοποιίας πα
ρ' ἑαυτοῦ ἀνέ
στησεν

div.head: Apparatus
div.p: Only Reinach gives the line divisions, but he seems to have read less, particularly at the end.
l. 1, Π . ΛΑΙΣΗΝ Reinach; ..]ΛΑΙΣΤ[..] K.&R.. Perhaps ΤΗ in ligature.
l. 2, Reinach did not read the initial Ν, K.&R. did not read the final Α.
l. 3, ΣΙΑ Reinach.
l. 4, ΝΙΑ Reinach, who did not read the final ΒΕ.
l. 9, ΒΕΡΕΙΝ Reinach.
l. 10, ΑΚΑΣΣΟΜΟΣ K.&R.
l. 19, Reinach did not read the initial I; ΤΡΙ Reinach, ΠΡΩ K.&R.
l. 20, Reinach did not read the final Σ.
l. 21, Reinach did not read Α, and wrote ἐπὶ τῇ πόλει.
l. 22, Reinach made out no letters in this line.
l. 24, Reinach read nothing after ΠΟ.
l. 25, Reinach read Ν ... ΛΓ ..., and nothing more

div.head: Translation
div.p: ?, ] wrestler, having won the Aphrodeisiea Adonea; Tiberius Claudius Aurelius Mucianos Apollonios Beroneikianos, the most distinguished, vice-neopoios for Tiberius Claudius Apollonios Beroneikianos Akasson, high-priest, his own grandfather, in the first cycle of the chief-neopoioate funded from the bequest of Apollonios, set up (the statue) from his own resources

p.rs: Necropolis, West; 50 m south west of the west gate (Kubitschek)

div.head: Text Constituted From
div.p: Publications, notebooks

div.head: History of Recording
div.p: Recorded by Kubitschek and Reichel (K V, 10; Abklatsch 18); not reported subsequently

div.head: Bibliography
div.p: Published by Kubitschek and Reichel, no. 11; published, independently, from their copy, Reinach 146bis, on which see Robert, Et. Anat., 432 n.5. Cited by Cormack, ABSA 59 (1964), 26, no.33, on which see Robert, 'Inscriptions d'Aphrodisias', 380 n.1 (=OMS VI, 4).. Published by Roueché, PPA 77

div.head: Photographs
div.p: None
